resources.string: You can discard only tsumo now
You can\'t declare kan if it breaks your riichi
This is the tutorial.\n\nTo navigate through it, click on left and right parts of the screen.

Riichi-mahjong consists of 34 different tiles. For each tile, there are 4 of them.

They belong to groups, such as Man, Pin, Sou (numerable tiles), Wind and Dragons (honour tiles).

Winds are called East, South, West, North, and dragons are just Red, White and Green.

The objective of Riichi-mahjong and this training application is to win a hand.\n\nIn a game, each player has 13 tiles in their hand. In every turn, you\'ll draw a tile, so the total number becomes 14.
Then, if your hand is not winning, you shall discard one from your hand.\n\nWhile you keep drawing and discarding tiles, your hand will have changes.

There are terms, such as Pairs, Sequences (Chii), Triplets (Pon) and Quads (Kan).

Pairs are just made of 2 identical tiles.

Triplets (Pon) are made of 3 identical tiles.

Sequences (Chii) are made of 3 consecutive tiles of the same numerable group.
Be aware, that sequences cannot be made of honour tiles, since they are not numerable.

Quad (Kan) is made of 4 identical tiles.

It also implies, that you must have one additional tile for other forms.

In order to keep it that way, you shall declare Kan.
Usually, when your hand consists of 4 Sequences or Triplets/Quads + 1 Pair, you are ready to declare your win!\n\nHowever, you need to have YAKU as well.

Yaku mostly is a specific pattern of tiles. However, some of them are just conditional.\n\nFor example, having only numerable tiles without any 1s and 9s is a yaku, and it\'s called All Simples (Tanyao).

Also you may have three identical Sequences (Chii) of different groups, it\'s called Mixed Triple Sequence (Sanshoku).\n\nThere are many of them, so please consider having list of Riichi-mahjong yaku while playing Riichit.
You must know, that having 4 completed forms of tiles and 1 pair without having a yaku may lead to penalty, that\'s called Chombo.

Now about some yaku, that aren't dependent on pattern of tiles, but on special condition.

For example, Riichi.

If you have almost completed your hand, discarded all unwanted tiles and need only one more to win, you may declare Riichi.

That means, you\'ll bet additional 1000 in-game points and lose opportunity to change your hand, but you\'ll have yaku if you win.\n\nYou must discard the tile you\'ve drawn until comes your winning tile or end of the game.
By the way, that situation where you need only one tile to win is called Tempai.

There\'s also another one yaku - Fully Concealed Hand (Menzen Tsumo).\n\nWhile playing with other players, you may make calls from them. This won\'t be covered in Riichit, but you may find this in Riichi-mahjong rules.

If you didn\'t make any calls and win by yourself (by calling Tsumo), you get additional yaku.\n\nYou must know, that the same requirement is for calling Riichi - you cannot do this if you\'ve made calls from other players in this round.

So in Riichit you may not worry about having yaku in your hand, but…

…the more you've got, the more your hand will be cost.

You might lose after some consecutive wins if your hands were cheap, so consider having more yaku!

We've almost finished. Now let's talk about Riichit game field.

At the bottom of your screen you have your hand.

At the bottom right is your tsumo-tile - the new tile in your hand.
You may also call Kan for having a quad of same tiles, Riichi for already discussed yaku, or Tsumo for calling a win by yourself.

At upper left will be your discard, but at upper right you have dora indicator.\n\nDora indicator points at your valuable tiles. For example, if dora indicator is 4 Man, then 5 man is a dora. 9 points at 1, for winds it\'s E -> S -> W -> N -> E, for dragons it\'s Red -> White -> Green -> Red.
Every dora tile in your hand increases your winning hand cost, however it\'s not a yaku.\n\nEvery called Kan opens one more dora indicator. And winning with Riichi will reveal hidden dora indicators!
Now that\'s it for a tutorial.
However, you shall look for Riichi-mahjong rules.\n\nA lot of things were left uncovered, and you might still need your yaku-list, because there\'re almost 40 of them!
